text:
Day by day, and with

each passing moment,

Strength | find to meet

my trials here;

Trusting in my Father's

wise bestowment,

I've no cause for worry or for fear.
He whose heart is kind

beyond all measure,

Gives unto me each day

what he deems best,

Lovingly its part of pain

and pleasure,

Mingling toil with peace and rest.

Everyday the Lord Himself is near me,
With a special mercy for each hour;
All my cares He fain would

bear and cheer me,

He whose name is Counsellor
and Power

The protection of His child

and treasure


Is a charge that on Himself He laid;
“As thy days, thy strength

shall be in measure,”

This the pledge to me He made.

Help me then in ev'ry tribulation
So to trust Thy promises, O Lord,
That | lose not faith’s
sweet consolation,
Offered me within Thy holy Word,
Help me, Lord, when toil and
trouble meeting,
E'er to take, as from a father's hand,
One by one, the days,
the moments fleeting
Till | reach the promised land.

*** Lina Sandell Berg
